recipe.ingredients: 1 pound beef sirloin or tenderloin, cut into 1-inch cubes, 1 large red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 large yellow bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 large green bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 large red onion, cut into 1-inch pieces, 8 cherry tomatoes, 8 small cremini mushrooms, cleaned, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 1 tablespoon low-sodium soy sauce, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, Wooden or metal skewers
recipe.directions: If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for at least 30 minutes to prevent burning. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, soy sauce, oregano, garlic powder, and black pepper for the marinade. Place the beef cubes in a resealable plastic bag and pour half of the marinade over the beef. Seal and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, up to 2 hours, turning the bag occasionally, Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Thread the marinated beef cubes, bell peppers, red onion, cherry tomatoes, and mushrooms onto the skewers, alternating the ingredients. Brush the vegetables with the remaining marinade, Grill the kebabs on the preheated grill, turning occasionally, until the beef is cooked to desired doneness and vegetables are tender, about 8 to 10 minutes for medium-rare. Serve immediately.
recipe.nutrition: Calories 250, Total fat 9g, Protein 26g, Cholesterol 60mg, Total carbohydrate 13g, Dietary fiber 3g, Monounsaturated fat 5g, Saturated fat 3g, Sugars 5g, Sodium 200mg, Potassium 650mg
